net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j
Class HttpResponse

java.lang.Object
  net.homeip.donaldm.httpdbase4j.HttpResponse

public class HttpResponse
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulates sending HTTP responses and provides several static methods for sending common HTTP error and informational responses.

Author:
Donald Munro

getHeader

public java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String k)
Get a header value that was set for this response.

Parameters:
k - The header key
Returns:
The header string for key k

getHeader

public java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String k,
                                  int index)
Get a header value that was set for this response.

Parameters:
k - The header key
index - If there is more than one value for the header key then return the kth value.
Returns:
The header for key k and index index

Send the Response headers

Returns:
true if successful otherwise false

sendHeaders

public boolean sendHeaders(long contentLength)
Send the Response headers

Parameters:
contentLength - The content length for the body text that will be sent with sendData. If contentLength is -1 then the length of the body set in the constructor will be used
Returns:
true if successfull otherwise false

sendData

public boolean sendData()
Send the Response data

Returns:
true if Response was successfully sent otherwise false

sendData

public boolean sendData(java.lang.String s)
Send the Response data

Parameters:
s - The string to send as the Response body. Note: This must be the same length as the contentLength set in sendHeaders.
Returns:
true if Response was successfully sent otherwise false

sendData

public boolean sendData(java.io.InputStream data)
Send the Response data

Parameters:
data - The stream to send as the Response body. Note: This must be the same length as the contentLength set in sendHeaders.
Returns:
true if Response was successfully sent otherwise false

send

public boolean send()
Send the Response using the body and/or status previously specified in the constructor. If the body is not specified then nol content is send only the headers.

Returns:
true if Response was successfully sent otherwise false
